results.name: Inverse permutation to A071653.
comment: A014137(n-1) = A071654(A072638(n)) for n>0 - _Antti Karttunen_, Jul 30 2012, based on _Paul D. Hanna_'s similar observation in A071653.
link: Antti Karttunen, Rows n=0..66 of triangle, flattened
Index entries for sequences that are permutations of the natural numbers
program: (Scheme functions below show the essential idea. For a complete source, see "Alternative Catalan Orderings" OEIS Wiki page.)
(define (unrank-bintree rank pr1 pr2) (cond ((zero? rank) (list)) (else (cons (unrank-bintree (pr1 (-1+ rank)) pr1 pr2) (unrank-bintree (pr2 (-1+ rank)) pr1 pr2)))))
xref: Inverse permutation: A071653. A071672 gives the corresponding parenthesizations (from the term 1 onward) encoded as binary numbers, i.e. A071672(n) = A063171(A071654(n)) for n >= 1.
results.author: _Antti Karttunen_, May 30 2002
